name: apoc.agg.first
description: Returns the first value from the given collection.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: A value to be aggregated.

name: apoc.agg.graph
description: Returns all distinct `NODE` and `RELATIONSHIP` values collected into a `MAP` with the keys `nodes` and `relationships`.

argumentDescription.name: path
argumentDescription.description: A path to return nodes and relationships from.

name: apoc.agg.last
description: Returns the last value from the given collection.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: A value to be aggregated.

signature: apoc.agg.maxItems(item :: ANY, value :: ANY, groupLimit = -1 :: INTEGER) :: ANY
name: apoc.agg.maxItems
description: Returns a `MAP` `{items: LIST<ANY>, value: ANY}` where the `value` key is the maximum value present, and `items` represent all items with the same value. The size of the list of items can be limited to a given max size.

argumentDescription.name: item
argumentDescription.description: A value to be aggregated.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: The value from which the max is selected.

argumentDescription.name: groupLimit
argumentDescription.description: The limit on the number of items returned.

name: apoc.agg.median
description: Returns the mathematical median for all non-null `INTEGER` and `FLOAT` values.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: A value to be aggregated.

signature: apoc.agg.minItems(item :: ANY, value :: ANY, groupLimit = -1 :: INTEGER) :: ANY
name: apoc.agg.minItems
description: Returns a `MAP` `{items: LIST<ANY>, value: ANY}` where the `value` key is the minimum value present, and `items` represent all items with the same value. The size of the list of items can be limited to a given max size.

argumentDescription.name: item
argumentDescription.description: A value to be aggregated.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: The value from which the min is selected.

argumentDescription.name: groupLimit
argumentDescription.description: The limit on the number of items returned.

name: apoc.agg.nth
description: Returns the nth value in the given collection (to fetch the last item of an unknown length collection, -1 can be used).

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: A value to be aggregated.

argumentDescription.name: offset
argumentDescription.description: The index of the value to be returned, or -1 to return the last item.

signature: apoc.agg.percentiles(value :: INTEGER | FLOAT, percentiles = [0.5, 0.75, 0.9, 0.95, 0.99] :: LIST<FLOAT>) :: LIST<ANY>
name: apoc.agg.percentiles
description: Returns the given percentiles over the range of numerical values in the given collection.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: A value to be aggregated.

argumentDescription.name: percentiles
argumentDescription.description: The percentiles from which the values are obtained.

name: apoc.agg.product
description: Returns the product of all non-null `INTEGER` and `FLOAT` values in the collection.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: A value to be multiplied in the aggregate.

signature: apoc.agg.slice(value :: ANY, from = 0 :: INTEGER, to = -1 :: INTEGER) :: LIST<ANY>
name: apoc.agg.slice
description:
Returns a subset of non-null values from the given collection (the collection is considered to be zero-indexed).
To specify the range from start until the end of the collection, the length should be set to -1.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: A value to be multiplied in the aggregate.

argumentDescription.name: from
argumentDescription.description: The index from which to start returning values in the specified range.

argumentDescription.name: to
argumentDescription.description: The non-inclusive index of the final value in the range.

signature: apoc.agg.statistics(value :: INTEGER | FLOAT, percentiles = [0.5, 0.75, 0.9, 0.95, 0.99] :: LIST<FLOAT>) :: MAP
name: apoc.agg.statistics
description: Returns the following statistics on the `INTEGER` and `FLOAT` values in the given collection: percentiles, min, minNonZero, max, total, mean, stdev.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: A value to be aggregated.

argumentDescription.name: percentiles
argumentDescription.description: The percentiles from which the values are obtained.

name: apoc.any.isDeleted
description: Returns true if the given `NODE` or `RELATIONSHIP` no longer exists.

argumentDescription.name: object
argumentDescription.description: The node or relationship to check the non-existence of.

signature: apoc.any.properties(object :: ANY, keys = null :: LIST<STRING>) :: MAP
name: apoc.any.properties
description:
Returns all properties of the given object.
The object can be a virtual `NODE`, a real `NODE`, a virtual `RELATIONSHIP`, a real `RELATIONSHIP`, or a `MAP`.

argumentDescription.name: object
argumentDescription.description: The object to return properties from.

argumentDescription.name: keys
argumentDescription.description: The keys of the properties to be returned (if null then all keys are returned).

name: apoc.any.property
description:
Returns the property for the given key from an object.
The object can be a virtual `NODE`, a real `NODE`, a virtual `RELATIONSHIP`, a real `RELATIONSHIP`, or a `MAP`.

argumentDescription.name: object
argumentDescription.description: The object to return a property from.

argumentDescription.name: key
argumentDescription.description: The key of the property to return.

signature: apoc.bitwise.op(a :: INTEGER, operator :: STRING, b :: INTEGER) :: INTEGER
name: apoc.bitwise.op
description: Returns the result of the bitwise operation

argumentDescription.name: a
argumentDescription.description: The lefthand side value of the bitwise operation.

argumentDescription.name: operator
argumentDescription.description: The type of bitwise operation to perform.

argumentDescription.name: b
argumentDescription.description: The righthand side value of the bitwise operation.

name: apoc.coll.avg
description: Returns the average of the numbers in the `LIST<INTEGER | FLOAT>`.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to return the average from.

signature: apoc.coll.combinations(coll :: LIST<ANY>, minSelect :: INTEGER, maxSelect = -1 :: INTEGER) :: LIST<ANY>
name: apoc.coll.combinations
description: Returns a collection of all combinations of `LIST<ANY>` elements between the selection size `minSelect` and `maxSelect` (default: `minSelect`).

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to return the combinations from.

argumentDescription.name: minSelect
argumentDescription.description: The minimum selection size of the combination.

argumentDescription.name: maxSelect
argumentDescription.description: The maximum selection size of the combination.

name: apoc.coll.contains
description: Returns whether or not the given value exists in the given collection.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to search for the given value.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: The value in the list to check for the existence of.

name: apoc.coll.containsAll
description: Returns whether or not all of the given values exist in the given collection.

argumentDescription.name: coll1
argumentDescription.description: The list to search for the given values in.

argumentDescription.name: coll2
argumentDescription.description: The list of values in the given list to check for the existence of.

name: apoc.coll.containsAllSorted
description: Returns whether or not all of the given values in the second `LIST<ANY>` exist in an already sorted collection (using a binary search).

argumentDescription.name: coll1
argumentDescription.description: The sorted list to search for the given values.

argumentDescription.name: coll2
argumentDescription.description: The list of values to check for existence of in the given list.

name: apoc.coll.containsDuplicates
description: Returns true if a collection contains duplicate elements.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to check for duplicates in.

name: apoc.coll.containsSorted
description: Returns whether or not the given value exists in an already sorted collection (using a binary search).

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The sorted list to search for the given value.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: The value to check for the existence of in the list.

name: apoc.coll.different
description: Returns true if all the values in the given `LIST<ANY>` are unique.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to check for duplicates.

name: apoc.coll.disjunction
description: Returns the disjunct set from two `LIST<ANY>` values.

argumentDescription.name: list1
argumentDescription.description: The list of values to compare against `list2` and form a disjunction from.

argumentDescription.name: list2
argumentDescription.description: The list of values to compare against `list1` and form a disjunction from.

name: apoc.coll.dropDuplicateNeighbors
description: Removes duplicate consecutive objects in the `LIST<ANY>`.

argumentDescription.name: list
argumentDescription.description: The list to remove duplicate consecutive values from.

name: apoc.coll.duplicates
description: Returns a `LIST<ANY>` of duplicate items in the collection.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to collect duplicate values from.

name: apoc.coll.duplicatesWithCount
description: Returns a `LIST<ANY>` of duplicate items in the collection and their count, keyed by `item` and `count`.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to collect duplicate values and their count from.

name: apoc.coll.fill
description: Returns a `LIST<ANY>` with the given count of items.

argumentDescription.name: item
argumentDescription.description: The item to be present in the returned list.

argumentDescription.name: count
argumentDescription.description: The number of times the given item should appear in the returned list.

signature: apoc.coll.flatten(coll :: LIST<ANY>, recursive = false :: BOOLEAN) :: LIST<ANY>
name: apoc.coll.flatten
description: Flattens the given `LIST<ANY>` (to flatten nested `LIST<ANY>` values, set recursive to true).

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to flatten.

argumentDescription.name: recursive
argumentDescription.description: Whether nested list items should also be flattened.

name: apoc.coll.frequencies
description: Returns a `LIST<ANY>` of frequencies of the items in the collection, keyed by `item` and `count`.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to return items and their count from.

name: apoc.coll.frequenciesAsMap
description: Returns a `MAP` of frequencies of the items in the collection, keyed by `item` and `count`.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to return items and their count from.

name: apoc.coll.indexOf
description: Returns the index for the first occurrence of the specified value in the `LIST<ANY>`.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to find the given value in.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: The value to find the first occurrence of in the given list.

signature: apoc.coll.insert(coll :: LIST<ANY>, index :: INTEGER, value :: ANY) :: LIST<ANY>
name: apoc.coll.insert
description: Inserts a value into the specified index in the `LIST<ANY>`.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to insert a value into.

argumentDescription.name: index
argumentDescription.description: The position in the list to insert the given value.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: The value to be inserted.

signature: apoc.coll.insertAll(coll :: LIST<ANY>, index :: INTEGER, values :: LIST<ANY>) :: LIST<ANY>
name: apoc.coll.insertAll
description: Inserts all of the values into the `LIST<ANY>`, starting at the specified index.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to insert the values into.

argumentDescription.name: index
argumentDescription.description: The position in the list to start inserting the given values.

argumentDescription.name: values
argumentDescription.description: The values to be inserted.

name: apoc.coll.intersection
description: Returns the distinct intersection of two `LIST<ANY>` values.

argumentDescription.name: list1
argumentDescription.description: The list of values to compare against `list2` and form an intersection from.

argumentDescription.name: list2
argumentDescription.description: The list of values to compare against `list1` and form an intersection from.

name: apoc.coll.isEqualCollection
description: Returns true if the two collections contain the same elements with the same cardinality in any order.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list of values to compare against `list2` and check for equality.

argumentDescription.name: values
argumentDescription.description: The list of values to compare against `list1` and check for equality.

name: apoc.coll.max
description: Returns the maximum of all values in the given `LIST<ANY>`.

argumentDescription.name: values
argumentDescription.description: The list to find the maximum in.

name: apoc.coll.min
description: Returns the minimum of all values in the given `LIST<ANY>`.

argumentDescription.name: values
argumentDescription.description: The list to find the minimum in.

name: apoc.coll.occurrences
description: Returns the count of the given item in the collection.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to collect the count of the given value from.

argumentDescription.name: item
argumentDescription.description: The value to count in the given list.

name: apoc.coll.pairWithOffset
description: Returns a `LIST<ANY>` of pairs defined by the offset.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to create pairs from.

argumentDescription.name: offset
argumentDescription.description: The offset to make each pair with from the given list.

name: apoc.coll.pairs
description: Returns a `LIST<ANY>` of adjacent elements in the `LIST<ANY>` ([1,2],[2,3],[3,null]).

argumentDescription.name: list
argumentDescription.description: The list to create pairs from.

name: apoc.coll.pairsMin
description: Returns `LIST<ANY>` values of adjacent elements in the `LIST<ANY>` ([1,2],[2,3]), skipping the final element.

argumentDescription.name: list
argumentDescription.description: The list to create pairs from.

name: apoc.coll.partition
description:
Partitions the original `LIST<ANY>` into a new `LIST<ANY>` of the given batch size.
The final `LIST<ANY>` may be smaller than the given batch size.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to partition into smaller sublists.

argumentDescription.name: batchSize
argumentDescription.description: The max size of each partitioned sublist.

name: apoc.coll.randomItem
description: Returns a random item from the `LIST<ANY>`, or null on `LIST<NOTHING>` or `LIST<NULL>`.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to return a random item from.

signature: apoc.coll.randomItems(coll :: LIST<ANY>, itemCount :: INTEGER, allowRepick = false :: BOOLEAN) :: LIST<ANY>
name: apoc.coll.randomItems
description: Returns a `LIST<ANY>` of `itemCount` random items from the original `LIST<ANY>` (optionally allowing elements in the original `LIST<ANY>` to be selected more than once).

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to return random items from.

argumentDescription.name: itemCount
argumentDescription.description: The number of random items to return from the list.

argumentDescription.name: allowRepick
argumentDescription.description: Whether elements from the original list can be selected more than once.

signature: apoc.coll.remove(coll :: LIST<ANY>, index :: INTEGER, length = 1 :: INTEGER) :: LIST<ANY>
name: apoc.coll.remove
description: Removes a range of values from the `LIST<ANY>`, beginning at position index for the given length of values.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to remove values from.

argumentDescription.name: index
argumentDescription.description: The starting index in the list to begin removing values from.

argumentDescription.name: length
argumentDescription.description: The number of values to remove.

name: apoc.coll.removeAll
description: Returns the first `LIST<ANY>` with all elements also present in the second `LIST<ANY>` removed.

argumentDescription.name: list1
argumentDescription.description: The list to remove values from.

argumentDescription.name: list2
argumentDescription.description: The values to remove from the given list.

name: apoc.coll.runningTotal
description: Returns an accumulative `LIST<INTEGER | FLOAT>`.

argumentDescription.name: list
argumentDescription.description: The list to return a running total from.

signature: apoc.coll.set(coll :: LIST<ANY>, index :: INTEGER, value :: ANY) :: LIST<ANY>
name: apoc.coll.set
description: Sets the element at the given index to the new value.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to be updated.

argumentDescription.name: index
argumentDescription.description: The position of the value in the list to be updated.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: The new value to be set.

name: apoc.coll.shuffle
description: Returns the `LIST<ANY>` shuffled.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to be shuffled.

name: apoc.coll.sort
description: Sorts the given `LIST<ANY>` into ascending order.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list to be sorted.

name: apoc.coll.sortMaps
description: Sorts the given `LIST<MAP<STRING, ANY>>` into descending order, based on the `MAP` property indicated by `prop`.

argumentDescription.name: list
argumentDescription.description: The list of maps to be sorted.

argumentDescription.name: prop
argumentDescription.description: The property key to be used to sort the list of maps by.

signature: apoc.coll.sortMulti(coll :: LIST<MAP>, orderFields = [] :: LIST<STRING>, limit = -1 :: INTEGER, skip = 0 :: INTEGER) :: LIST<ANY>
name: apoc.coll.sortMulti
description:
Sorts the given `LIST<MAP<STRING, ANY>>` by the given fields.
To indicate that a field should be sorted according to ascending values, prefix it with a caret (^).
It is also possible to add limits to the `LIST<MAP<STRING, ANY>>` and to skip values.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list of maps to be sorted.

argumentDescription.name: orderFields
argumentDescription.description: The property keys to be used to sort the list of maps by.

argumentDescription.name: limit
argumentDescription.description: The amount of results to return.

argumentDescription.name: skip
argumentDescription.description: The amount to skip by.

name: apoc.coll.sortNodes
description: Sorts the given `LIST<NODE>` by the property of the nodes into descending order.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list of nodes to be sorted.

argumentDescription.name: prop
argumentDescription.description: The property key on the node to be used to sort the list by.

name: apoc.coll.sortText
description: Sorts the given `LIST<STRING>` into ascending order.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list of strings to be sorted.

argumentDescription.name: conf
argumentDescription.description: A map containing a single key `locale` to indicate which language to use when sorting the strings.

signature: apoc.coll.stdev(list :: LIST<INTEGER | FLOAT>, isBiasCorrected = true :: BOOLEAN) :: INTEGER | FLOAT
name: apoc.coll.stdev
description: Returns sample or population standard deviation with `isBiasCorrected` true or false respectively.

argumentDescription.name: list
argumentDescription.description: A list to collect the standard deviation from.

argumentDescription.name: isBiasCorrected
argumentDescription.description: Will perform a sample standard deviation if `isBiasCorrected`, otherwise a population standard deviation is performed.

name: apoc.coll.subtract
description: Returns the first `LIST<ANY>` as a set with all the elements of the second `LIST<ANY>` removed.

argumentDescription.name: list1
argumentDescription.description: The list to remove values from.

argumentDescription.name: list2
argumentDescription.description: The list of values to be removed from `list1`.

name: apoc.coll.sum
description: Returns the sum of all the `INTEGER | FLOAT` in the `LIST<INTEGER | FLOAT>`.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list of numbers to create a sum from.

name: apoc.coll.sumLongs
description: Returns the sum of all the `INTEGER | FLOAT` in the `LIST<INTEGER | FLOAT>`.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list of numbers to create a sum from after each is cast to a java Long value.

name: apoc.coll.toSet
description: Returns a unique `LIST<ANY>` from the given `LIST<ANY>`.

argumentDescription.name: coll
argumentDescription.description: The list of values to remove all duplicates from.

name: apoc.coll.union
description: Returns the distinct union of the two given `LIST<ANY>` values.

argumentDescription.name: list1
argumentDescription.description: The list of values to compare against `list2` and form a distinct union from.

argumentDescription.name: list2
argumentDescription.description: The list of values to compare against `list1` and form a distinct union from.

name: apoc.coll.unionAll
description: Returns the full union of the two given `LIST<ANY>` values (duplicates included).

argumentDescription.name: list1
argumentDescription.description: The list of values to compare against `list2` and form a union from.

argumentDescription.name: list2
argumentDescription.description: The list of values to compare against `list1` and form a union from.

name: apoc.coll.zip
description: Returns the two given `LIST<ANY>` values zipped together as a `LIST<LIST<ANY>>`.

argumentDescription.name: list1
argumentDescription.description: The list to zip together with `list2`.

argumentDescription.name: list2
argumentDescription.description: The list to zip together with `list1`.

signature: apoc.convert.fromJsonList(list :: STRING, path =  :: STRING, pathOptions = null :: LIST<STRING>) :: LIST<ANY>
name: apoc.convert.fromJsonList
description: Converts the given JSON list into a Cypher `LIST<STRING>`.

argumentDescription.name: list
argumentDescription.description: A JSON stringified list.

argumentDescription.name: path
argumentDescription.description: A JSON path expression used to extract a certain part from the list.

argumentDescription.name: pathOptions
argumentDescription.description: JSON path options: ('ALWAYS_RETURN_LIST', 'AS_PATH_LIST', 'DEFAULT_PATH_LEAF_TO_NULL', 'REQUIRE_PROPERTIES', 'SUPPRESS_EXCEPTIONS')

signature: apoc.convert.fromJsonMap(map :: STRING, path =  :: STRING, pathOptions = null :: LIST<STRING>) :: MAP
name: apoc.convert.fromJsonMap
description: Converts the given JSON map into a Cypher `MAP`.

argumentDescription.name: map
argumentDescription.description: A JSON stringified map.

argumentDescription.name: path
argumentDescription.description: A JSON path expression used to extract a certain part from the map.

argumentDescription.name: pathOptions
argumentDescription.description: JSON path options: ('ALWAYS_RETURN_LIST', 'AS_PATH_LIST', 'DEFAULT_PATH_LEAF_TO_NULL', 'REQUIRE_PROPERTIES', 'SUPPRESS_EXCEPTIONS')

signature: apoc.convert.getJsonProperty(node :: NODE, key :: STRING, path =  :: STRING, pathOptions = null :: LIST<STRING>) :: ANY
name: apoc.convert.getJsonProperty
description: Converts a serialized JSON object from the property of the given `NODE` into the equivalent Cypher structure (e.g. `MAP`, `LIST<ANY>`).

argumentDescription.name: node
argumentDescription.description: The node containing a JSON string property.

argumentDescription.name: key
argumentDescription.description: The property key to convert.

argumentDescription.name: path
argumentDescription.description: A JSON path expression used to extract a certain part from the node property string.

argumentDescription.name: pathOptions
argumentDescription.description: JSON path options: ('ALWAYS_RETURN_LIST', 'AS_PATH_LIST', 'DEFAULT_PATH_LEAF_TO_NULL', 'REQUIRE_PROPERTIES', 'SUPPRESS_EXCEPTIONS')

signature: apoc.convert.getJsonPropertyMap(node :: NODE, key :: STRING, path =  :: STRING, pathOptions = null :: LIST<STRING>) :: MAP
name: apoc.convert.getJsonPropertyMap
description: Converts a serialized JSON object from the property of the given `NODE` into a Cypher `MAP`.

argumentDescription.name: node
argumentDescription.description: The node containing a JSON stringified map.

argumentDescription.name: key
argumentDescription.description: The property key to convert.

argumentDescription.name: path
argumentDescription.description: A JSON path expression used to extract a certain part from the node property string.

argumentDescription.name: pathOptions
argumentDescription.description: JSON path options: ('ALWAYS_RETURN_LIST', 'AS_PATH_LIST', 'DEFAULT_PATH_LEAF_TO_NULL', 'REQUIRE_PROPERTIES', 'SUPPRESS_EXCEPTIONS')

name: apoc.convert.toJson
description: Serializes the given JSON value.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: The value to serialize.

name: apoc.convert.toList
description: Converts the given value into a `LIST<ANY>`.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: The value to convert into a list.

name: apoc.convert.toMap
description: Converts the given value into a `MAP`.

argumentDescription.name: map
argumentDescription.description: The value to convert into a map.

name: apoc.convert.toNode
description: Converts the given value into a `NODE`.

argumentDescription.name: node
argumentDescription.description: The value to convert into a node.

name: apoc.convert.toNodeList
description: Converts the given value into a `LIST<NODE>`.

argumentDescription.name: list
argumentDescription.description: The value to covert into a node list.

name: apoc.convert.toRelationship
description: Converts the given value into a `RELATIONSHIP`.

argumentDescription.name: rel
argumentDescription.description: The value to convert into a relationship.

name: apoc.convert.toRelationshipList
description: Converts the given value into a `LIST<RELATIONSHIP>`.

argumentDescription.name: relList
argumentDescription.description: The value to convert into a relationship list.

name: apoc.convert.toSet
description: Converts the given value into a set represented in Cypher as a `LIST<ANY>`.

argumentDescription.name: list
argumentDescription.description: The list to convert into a set.

signature: apoc.convert.toSortedJsonMap(value :: ANY, ignoreCase = true :: BOOLEAN) :: STRING
name: apoc.convert.toSortedJsonMap
description: Converts a serialized JSON object from the property of a given `NODE` into a Cypher `MAP`.

argumentDescription.name: value
argumentDescription.description: The value to convert into a stringified JSON map.

argumentDescription.name: ignoreCase
argumentDescription.description: Whether or not to ignore the case of the keys when sorting.

name: apoc.create.uuid
description: Returns a UUID.

name: apoc.create.uuidBase64
description: Returns a UUID encoded with base64.

name: apoc.create.uuidBase64ToHex
description: Takes the given base64 encoded UUID and returns it as a hexadecimal `STRING`.

argumentDescription.name: base64Uuid
argumentDescription.description: The string representing a UUID encoded with Base64.

name: apoc.create.uuidHexToBase64
description: Takes the given UUID represented as a hexadecimal `STRING` and returns it encoded with base64.

argumentDescription.name: uuid
argumentDescription.description: The UUID represented as a hexadecimal string.

name: apoc.create.vNode
description: Returns a virtual `NODE`.

argumentDescription.name: labels
argumentDescription.description: The list of labels to assign to the virtual node.

argumentDescription.name: props
argumentDescription.description: The map of properties to assign to the virtual node.

signature: apoc.create.vRelationship(from :: NODE, relType :: STRING, props :: MAP, to :: NODE) :: RELATIONSHIP
name: apoc.create.vRelationship
description: Returns a virtual `RELATIONSHIP`.

argumentDescription.name: from
argumentDescription.description: The start node to assign to the virtual relationship.

argumentDescription.name: relType
argumentDescription.description: The type to assign to the virtual relationship.

argumentDescription.name: props
argumentDescription.description: The map of properties to assign to the virtual relationship.

argumentDescription.name: to
argumentDescription.description: The end node to assign to the virtual relationship.

name: apoc.create.virtual.fromNode
description: Returns a virtual `NODE` from the given existing `NODE`. The virtual `NODE` only contains the requested properties.

argumentDescription.name: node
argumentDescription.description: The node to generate a virtual node from.

argumentDescription.name: propertyNames
argumentDescription.description: The properties to copy to the virtual node.

name: apoc.cypher.runFirstColumnMany
description: Runs the given statement with the given parameters and returns the first column collected into a `LIST<ANY>`.

argumentDescription.name: statement
argumentDescription.description: The Cypher query to execute.

argumentDescription.name: params
argumentDescription.description: The parameters needed for input to the given Cypher query.

name: apoc.cypher.runFirstColumnSingle
description: Runs the given statement with the given parameters and returns the first element of the first column.

argumentDescription.name: statement
argumentDescription.description: The Cypher query to execute.

argumentDescription.name: params
argumentDescription.description: The parameters needed for input to the given Cypher query.

name: apoc.data.url
description: Turns a URL into a `MAP`.

argumentDescription.name: url
argumentDescription.description: The URL to extract metadata from.

signature: apoc.date.add(time :: INTEGER, unit :: STRING, addValue :: INTEGER, addUnit :: STRING) :: INTEGER
name: apoc.date.add
description: Adds a unit of specified time to the given timestamp.

argumentDescription.name: time
argumentDescription.description: The timestamp to add time to.

argumentDescription.name: unit
argumentDescription.description: The unit the given timestamp is in.

argumentDescription.name: addValue
argumentDescription.description: The amount of time to add to the given timestamp.

argumentDescription.name: addUnit
argumentDescription.description: The unit the added value is in.

name: apoc.hashing.fingerprint
description:
Calculates a MD5 checksum over a `NODE` or `RELATIONSHIP` (identical entities share the same checksum).
Unsuitable for cryptographic use-cases.

argumentDescription.description: A node or relationship to hash.

argumentDescription.name: excludedPropertyKeys

name: apoc.hashing.fingerprintGraph

Calculates a MD5 checksum over the full graph.
This function uses in-memory data structures.
Unsuitable for cryptographic use-cases.

argumentDescription.description: Property keys to exclude from the hashing.

name: apoc.hashing.fingerprinting
description:
Calculates a MD5 checksum over a `NODE` or `RELATIONSHIP` (identical entities share the same checksum).
Unlike `apoc.hashing.fingerprint()`, this function supports a number of config parameters.
Unsuitable for cryptographic use-cases.

argumentDescription.name: object
argumentDescription.description: A node or relationship to hash.

argumentDescription.name: config
argumentDescription.description:
{
    digestAlgorithm = "MD5" :: STRING,
    strategy = "LAZY" :: STRING,
    nodeAllowMap = [] :: MAP<STRING, LIST<STRING>>,
    relAllowMap = [] :: MAP<STRING, LIST<STRING>>,
    relDisallowMap = [] :: MAP<STRING, LIST<STRING>>,
    mapAllowList = [] :: LIST<STRING>,
    mapDisallowList = [] :: LIST<STRING>,
    allNodesAllowList = [] :: LIST<STRING>,
    allNodesDisallowList = [] :: LIST<STRING>,
    allRelsAllowList = [] :: LIST<STRING>,
    allRelsDisallowList = [] :: LIST<STRING>
}
